hypotheses: Political polarization negatively affects government size in democratic countries.
The relationship between political polarization and government size differs between democratic and undemocratic countries.
claim.statement: Political polarization negatively affects the size of government in democratic countries, as evidenced by the dispersion of voter preferences.

data.notes: Polarization measured via standard deviation of responses to economic policy questions.

method.description: The study investigates the impact of political polarization on government size using data from surveys and regression analysis with various control variables.
steps: Collect data from World Values Survey.
Measure political polarization using standard deviation of survey responses.
Conduct regression analysis considering control variables like GDP per capita, income inequality.
Analyze relationship between polarization and government size in different democratic contexts.
method.outcome_variable: Government size (consumption as fraction of total consumption)

results.summary: The study finds a strong negative correlation between political polarization and government size in democratic countries, independent of other variables.
